metadata.title: CVE-2017-7374 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in fs/crypto/ in the Linux kernel before4.10.7 allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointerdereference) or possibly gain privileges by revoking keyring keys beingused for ext4, f2fs, or ubifs encryption, causing cryptographic transformobjects to be freed prematurely.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7374` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-75-generic - 4.4.0-75.96
linux-image-4.4.0-75-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-75.96
linux-image-4.4.0-75-lowlatency - 4.4.0-75.96
linux-image-4.4.0-75-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-75.96
linux-image-4.4.0-75-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-75.96
linux-image-4.4.0-75-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-75.96
linux-image-4.4.0-75-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-75.96
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-75-generic - 4.4.0-75.96
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1054.61
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-58-lowlatency - 4.8.0-58.63~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-58-generic - 4.8.0-58.63~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-gke - 4.4.0-1012.12

No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-75.96').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1054.61').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1057.61').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1016.25').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-58.63~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1012.12').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-euclid package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-9019.20').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
